flashback.speaker: Ashera
flashback.line: Lehran... I will not...countenance this plan.

flashback.speaker: Lehran
flashback.line: Hear me, Goddess Ashera... Yune's imprisonment within the medallion has begun to change you. Order and chaos, you are one being, comprising both parts. The one must naturally affect the other.

flashback.speaker: Ashera
flashback.line: Even so, I will not return Yune to this body. She is unstable, and I must be perfect in order to protect this world. It is as I have said, Yune must be destroyed.

flashback.speaker: Lehran
flashback.line: Ashera, you mustn't! You cannot survive without your opposite. Please, you must not do this. Your world still needs you.

flashback.speaker: Ashera
flashback.line: Lehran, you have ever been a wise and kind- hearted child. In deference to you, I will place my faith in your kind one last time. For the next thousand years, I shall sleep as well. When I wake again, I hope it is to a world of peace and order, where all prosper as equals. If I do, then I will know that you have advised me well. I will reward your counsel. I will also allow Yune to return to me. I will once again be the goddess of creation, whole and complete. Ashunera, the Dawn Goddess... The name your ancestors gave me so long ago. I should like to hear it again.

flashback.speaker: Ashera
flashback.line: However, during this thousand years, if the chaos of war should arise and awaken Yune from her slumber in the medallion... I will know that you have strayed from your path, and I will punish your failure as I would reward your success. And then you will know my judgment. You will pay for your sins, each of you to the last.

flashback.speaker: Lehran
flashback.line: In the names of our people, we vow to keep this covenant. There will be no great war between laguz and beorc for a thousand years. So pledge Altina of the beorc, Dheginsea of the dragon tribes, Soan of the beast tribes, and I, Lehran, of the bird tribes.

flashback.speaker: Ashera
flashback.line: If you believe during this thousand years that you have created a world that has outgrown the atrocities of war... Or if you feel the world has fallen beyond hope of redemption, you may sing the galdr of release and awaken us both. Your heirs will possess that ability as well... Sing to awaken us, and tell us your tale. Tell us of the world your two kinds have built in our absence. We will listen, and we will judge fairly and impartially. This is our covenant with you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It's her...

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Ashera.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Ashera! It's me...Yune. Can you hear me?

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Please! Please listen to me! You don't need to pass any more judgment! You can return the people to normal!

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: I cannot. There are still people in my world who are made of fallible flesh. This imperfect world has passed beyond control. Now, I shall pass my final judgment.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Wait! You can't violate the terms of the covenant, Ashera! One thousand years still hasn't passed. We were woken by galdr, not by mankind's war.

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: It doesn't matter.

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: During my long sleep, beorc and laguz continued to fight. The children of flesh will never learn nor grow. Time will pass as always, but nothing can change the destiny of mankind.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: You have to look deeper! The first judgment didn't turn everyone to stone, and I'll tell you why. Because these people are not "people" as we know them. Ashera, these people have become something new!

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: People--the Zunanma--are the only living creatures of this world that we didn't create. Animals evolved to become Zunanma, who then became laguz and beorc. That evolution continues today!

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Ashera... I'll tell you a secret you didn't know.  Children can be born of both a beorc and laguz parent. They are still very few in number, but if allowed to flourish, mankind might become anything! If the two races continue to evolve, I'm sure something wonderful will emerge! You can't just bring that to a halt.

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: Do not claim certainty of anything. The children of this world are born of chaos, and nothing could be more uncertain. The world does not require the evolution of man. My responsibility is to protect order, the balance of all life-forms. Beings that evolve without my guidance will only destabilize and threaten this world. Because of that--

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: You have to wipe out everything made of flesh? Is that what you're trying to say? ...Very well then.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: You and I have nothing more to talk about. My only choice is to defeat you.

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: Yune, do not be absurd... You cannot overthrow me, just as I cannot overthrow you.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Of course not. But they can. Everyone! The time has come! Defeat Ashera, or everyone you love will be a statue forever!

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: These people, they carry your blessing, Yune... You mean to fight me?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ashera, our goddess... This is the world--and we are the people--you created. You make it sound as if we're some sort of filthy creatures that just decided to settle down here and cause trouble.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Ike! Don't say it like that.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We're not perfect. Sometimes our brains tell us one thing, while our emotions tell us another. And war... The more we try to avoid it, the worse it is when it comes to us.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: People are probably the dumbest creatures alive.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: But... Somehow you're also the most endearing. It's your imperfections that make you so interesting... Imperfections very similar to ours.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We know that we've messed up. We'll do our best to avoid more war and to make peace our highest priority. Ashera, just give us one more chance. All we ask for is one more chance.

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: You expect me to reverse my judgment? The goddess of order cannot be so...mercurial. My decision is final.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So that's how it's going to be, huh? Then we will fight...  and we will save our people. Make your peace with whatever the gods worship. Your end is near.

intro.speaker: Ashera
intro.line: My end  is near?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: In every battle that mattered in my life, I've always been the one left standing, no matter how slim my chances. This battle means more than any of the others, because it's for the life of every person that I've ever cared about. I will win this fight.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Ike... Um... Were you joking when you said you couldn't remember how we met?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well, sorta. It was a long time ago.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: How could you forget?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Relax, Soren. I got to thinking, and I remembered. I remember what happened in Gallia on the day we first met.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Ike...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Mother had gone shopping with Mist that day. I was wandering around the village all alone. I walked to the edge of the forest, looking for a stick I could pretend was a sword. There was a raven-haired boy lying on the ground.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: I remember the huge oak tree by the clearing... I'd been sleeping in the hollow by the roots.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: He looked like he was my age. He was as skinny as a twig, wearing rags and covered in dirt. He looked like he was near death. I took out my lunch and I handed it to him. He made a noise like a scared animal and shied away. He was suspicious of me at first, but eventually he took my sandwich and started to eat. It was like he'd never eaten before in his life. I didn't have anything else to feed him, so I told him to come to my house. But he kept shaking his head no.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: I was afraid you were going to trick me. Afraid that you were going to chase me away after taunting me with food, just for a laugh...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I told the boy that I'd bring him some food the next day at the same time and place. He finally nodded when I said that. It made me happy. I felt like I was doing something right, helping this boy. Like I was the only one who'd do that.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: ...I was happy, too. Not just because I wasn't hungry anymore. Because someone finally would talk to me. So I went back to the village again the next day. I was scared of the other villagers and their rocks and sticks, but I still went back.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That's right. That was Gallia back then. The beorc abused and tormented the Branded because the laguz shunned them. They wanted to avoid upsetting the laguz.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: The villagers threw stones at me, called me an animal and a devil. But on the next day, the village was littered with corpses. Soldiers and peasants were in a panic.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It was my dad. He went crazy when the spirit of chaos in the medallion touched him.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: I walked through the empty streets, checking bodies to see if you were dead. But I couldn't find you. I decided that you had to be alive. I took money and food from the village and headed for Crimea, a land of beorcs.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Soren...

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: On my way to Crimea, I kept seeing laguz from the beast tribe. They were terrifying, but after a while I realized something. They never attacked me. They all seemed to notice something about me, and then pretend they couldn't see me. That look was burned into my mind, and it was always the same. They'd scowl, then walk away like they'd never noticed me. In a way, that left me feeling older and more alone than if they'd attacked me. Hate... That I could understand. This was denial. They made me feel like I wasn't supposed to exist at all. That my simply being alive was an affront to the world. That was how the beasts treated me. And I hated them for it. It sat in my heart like a lead bar. Like a glacier.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: When I reached Crimea, I took refuge in a church along the way. They took my brand to be a sign that I had been trained in the arcane arts. They took good care of me, and taught me things. Once I had learned to speak and behave like other people, I wandered Crimea for several years. Then I finally found you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: But I'd...

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Yes. You'd forgotten that day in Gallia. But I didn't care. My only wish was to see you again. I just wanted to see the only boy who had held out a warm hand when I had nothing.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Soren... Don't cry.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Don't cry? What? I'm not crying...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Soren, you're smart, but you're no good when it comes to your emotions. Come over here.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: D-don't treat me like I'm a child! I'm not that--

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Come on.

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: Shut up! Shut up...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Then I'll come over to you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's all in the past, Soren...

conversation.speaker: Soren
conversation.line: ...Sniff... Sniff... Gwuh... Wahhhhhhhh! Ahhhhhhh!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: We did it. Our fighting is finally done. Now the people...

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Now the people should all turn back to normal.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Let's get out of here. I'm sure the others are getting tired of waiting for us outside.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: What... What's going on? This is insane! We defeated her...

battle.speaker: Ashera
battle.line: You defeated nothing. This is nothing at all out of the ordinary. Mortals cannot defeat the divine. It is not possible.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: But... We won... General Ike... We have to fight one more time! The people out there need our help!

battle.speaker: Ashera
battle.line: You can try as many times as you like. The result will always be the same. There is no way for you to win.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: I can't believe that! General Ike, you can do it! Forge a new destiny for us! Ike, please... You've got to!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: I don't need encouragement. I'd fight to the end no matter what. Ashera, you can't stop me. It doesn't matter if you're a goddess. It doesn't matter if I have no way to win. Fighting defines me, and I will not lose.

battle.speaker: Ashera
battle.line: When will you tiresome gnats surrender?

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: I resided in Goldoa for more than seven hundred years.

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: That's because I was kept in hiding. But I did meet you several times, when you were just an infant.

battle-talk.speaker: Kurthnaga
battle-talk.line: I remember a...a mysterious man with black wings. Was that you? I always thought it was a dream...

battle-talk.speaker: Kurthnaga
battle-talk.line: I was always so fascinated by that man and his songs... I remember him well, and fondly.

battle-talk.speaker: Sanaki
battle-talk.line: I was starting to wonder how I would punish you.

battle-talk.speaker: Sanaki
battle-talk.line: You are my subordinate, after all. I have decided that leaving one's empress to die is punishable by drowning in a pool of rancid butter.

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: Of course it is, my empress.

battle-talk.speaker: Sanaki
battle-talk.line: I hope you're a strong swimmer.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: You... Forgive me for asking, but... Aren't you my--

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: Can we talk about this later?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: What? Oh, I mean, of course... Sorry to bother you...

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: Child, you couldn't possibly bother me. It's just, the talk you and I must have is going to take a long time. I don't think Ashera would wait for us to finish.

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: Looks like you could use some backup. I'm good with a staff, too, you know.

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: I can't apologize enough. I was so terribly mistaken, and now there's nothing I can do to help.

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: What? z Ike: Wanting to do something that matters is enough. Sometimes, how you feel is more important than how you act.

battle-talk.speaker: Lehran
battle-talk.line: Ike, I... There's no one that I think more highly of...

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: No time for compliments. We still have work to do here.

boss.speaker: Ashera
boss.line: You would face me in battle? I need no further evidence of your kind's imperfections. This will hardly be a battle at all. Simply an end. Perish, flawed one.

boss.speaker: Ashera
boss.line: It is tragic that you are too limited to see how hopeless this is. You cannot hope to defeat the divine.

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: You're right. We can't hope to defeat you.

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: You haven't left us much choice. I'd rather die like this instead of being turned into some mindless statue.

boss.speaker: Ashera
boss.line: Don't waste your energy, fleshling. You are physically unable to harm me.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: Yune... I'm fine. I can hear you. No, I'm not afraid. I know you're with me.

boss.speaker: Ashera
boss.line: Ah, son of the dragon king... You may be the greatest among the enfleshed, but you are no match for me.

boss.speaker: Kurth
boss.line: Goddess Ashera, please listen to me. We know that we are clearly imperfect, but you, unnaturally created of pure order... Might that not be considered an imperfection?

boss.speaker: Ashera
boss.line: No, I am perfect. Free of emotion, I have no doubts. Therefore I commit no errors.

boss.speaker: Ashera
boss.line: Lehran, you have joined my enemies?

boss.speaker: Lehran
boss.line: My goddess... Never before have I defied you in even the least thing. But I have seen the error of my ways and wish to save the people whom I once desired to destroy. I am one man, and my life is precious. How much more precious are the lives of the countless multitudes?

cutscene.speaker: Yune
cutscene.line: We have to put an end to this. Take all the power I have.

cutscene.speaker: Ike
cutscene.line: Thank you. I'll use it well.

cutscene.speaker: Ike
cutscene.line: What of you? Are you leaving?

cutscene.speaker: Yune
cutscene.line: I am. But I believe it's for the best. This world does not need gods. We have always failed you. We've made you weak. That's why we must...go.

cutscene.speaker: Ike
cutscene.line: It's true, we don't have much use for gods. But, well... You show us what we should aspire to. We need inspiration. You give us a reason to grow. To become more than we are.

cutscene.speaker: Ike
cutscene.line: And if we don't have that, Yune, we're nothing more than statues.

cutscene.speaker: Yune
cutscene.line: Can you forgive me for the pain I've caused?

cutscene.speaker: Ike
cutscene.line: I don't know. But you have already forgiven us. How could we not?

cutscene.speaker: Ike
cutscene.line: We are all family. We will try to understand one another, even when we disagree.

cutscene.speaker: Yune
cutscene.line: You're right. I will try. One more time.
